Text: [boy] It comes on a full moon...
That's what Ma used to say.
A pregnant girl who died before her time.
Only it ain't a babe no more.
I swear, Witcher, that's what got me.
I swear on my ma's grave, I saw it--
♪ And yet her dead heart did beat ♪
I don't recall the bard  singing of this one.
Who would dare  try and rob you of your treasure?
When you live as long as I do, all the names start to sound the same.
[sighs] Were destiny a kinder bitch,  a whore like me
wouldn't have to settle for  her client's telltales.
A friend of yours came through here last month headed for Temeria.
Mm. Blessed that prick with my fullest efforts, too,
Do you not just hear me talking?
A few miners rounded up 3,000 orens to have it killed.
Your boy took the coin and ran.
I'll be back with payment in a few days.
Years of attacks by this creature, and the king does nothing.
We must force his hand. Lay down our picks...
And a half-measure ain't gonna do! We've got to move on.
Plenty of work south of Sodden.
the king diddled whores while his subjects starved.
And he rallied the people, and they took back what was theirs!
I say we follow their lead!
so you decide to kill your king?
Your kind already swindled us once.
I take payment after the job is done and for a third of the price.
And if you can't kill it?
Lower your weapons and return to your homes.
Do so quickly and without further theatrics...
and you have my word that our king  will not hear of this treason.
He hides in his winter castle as we are eaten.
Revenge will not ease your pain.
See this one to our borders.
Temeria's had their fill... of witchers.
You can put down your sword. I'm not here to hurt you.
Says the witch hiding in the woods.
Triss Merigold.  I serve King Foltest.
So he makes a show of kicking me out...
then sends his errand girl to slip me some coin
Not a very original plan for a king.
And I don't want you to kill the beast.
I want you to help me save it.
stable hands started vanishing at the castle above the city.
Before long, citizens were disappearing throughout all Temeria.
Foltest's royal guards soon realized the creature was coming from the crypt
where the king's sister Adda is buried.
Rumor has it she was having an affair  with a young man in town when she died.
If she were, that would make her child the sole heir to the throne
The king fled the castle, ignoring the rising death toll.
the Brotherhood  couldn't risk it happening again,
so they sent me here three months ago to cure the creature.
Good thing it's not a vukodlak.
Two thousand orens if you can tell me what exactly killed these people.
You didn't want the people to know that it bested a witcher.
And you let them believe that he fled with their coin.
His heart's missing along with his liver.
Only one creature I know is that picky an eater.
The only way to make one is through a curse.
But the curse didn't stop with Adda. It turned her daughter into a monster.
It was a nice touch with the applause.
So how many more times do you think we get to do this?
Soon you'll be off to your ruins, dashing explorer.
Stregebor says Temeria leans heavily on its mages.
So maybe you'll be too busy for me.
Or maybe you'll be too busy for me once you get a taste of Aedirn revelry.
If I do a good job...
I can persuade him to give you access to our ruins.
Well, after the initiation today, we're in charge.
We get to make the decisions, be who we want to be.
Fringilla and the others  see their ideal selves so clearly.
They know exactly what they want for their enchantments.
Easy for a Ban Ard boy.
You dolts needn't change a single wrinkle before heading to court.
Remember that scared girl  who tumbled at your feet in this cave...
I want to go back home to Aedirn and never be her again.
Let me be candid. You are a... first draft of what nature intended, yes?
Lucky for you, I'm the final artist.
Every girl I enchant  leaves Aretuza a living work of art.
No matter how challenging the clay.
A gray dress assumes importance without bald ambition.
Ah. Not the final look. More a preview.
There is not a person alive
that does not look into the mirror and see some deformity.
We remake ourselves on our terms. The world has no say in it.
You can free the victim in the mirror forever.
I don't know where to begin.
Imagine the most powerful woman in the world.
Her hair, the color of her eyes, yes...
but also the strength of her posture.
The poise of her entire being.
Miss Merigold, you were dispatched  to settle a family affair,
not to enlist a mutant mercenary for a game of sleuthing.
This is no game, Captain. Tonight is a full moon,
and Geralt has already proved himself  to be invaluable.
We believe we can cure the creature.
Then you will refer to her as Her Royal Highness.
The witcher's theory is nonsense. Princess Adda was the people's angel.
Seditious rumors. Idle courtesans  trading out boredom for jealousy.
Perhaps if you called off your guards,
if we were able to search the abandoned castle,
we could find clues as to who cursed her.
[Segelin] Except this witcher  would kill the princess as she sleeps,
Call her a unicorn if you'd like to.
She grew inside Adda, feeding on her petrified womb.
Growing for years  till she got so hungry...
she was forced to slither out.
Rotten muscle, bent bones, two spidery legs,
claws dragging in the dirt. An overgrown abortion.
Open this door! Protect the king!
My men will kill you, Witcher.
You learn that your sister was murdered, and you didn't even flinch.
But the moment I mention the girl's father...
You are speaking to a king.
Why not produce your own heir?
Why not kill the striga  and avoid this revolt?
I remember hearing stories about witchers when I was a child.
Is it true what they say?
That the mutations that grant you your... abilities
'Cause only a man devoid of all heart
could accuse a brother of bedding his murdered sister
while urging him to kill her.
[Tissaia] Cintra continues their animosity towards our organization.
[Artorius] Don't tell me  they're employing druids
King Dagorad has banned mages from Cintra, God knows why.
I've heard rumors he's taken ill.
Now, if the king dies, perhaps his heiress will be more pliable. Princess...
Word is she's even more stubborn than her father is.
King Fergus is proving to be an effective and excitable young king.
Spending the kingdom's money on women as his people starve to death.
Fringilla will be in Nilfgaard by week's end.
She will bring sanity and bread to the people.
Your girl is-- With all due respect,
your niece is only capable of doing what she's told.
No ambitious mage wants to be assigned anywhere south of Sodden.
Perhaps we consider sending someone there with a bit more... spine.
Stregobor, did you have anyone in mind?
We agreed Yennefer would thrive in Aedirn.
King Virfuril  prefers mages from his kingdom,
and Yennefer was born in Vengerberg.
Oh, we'd be spitting in Dagorad's face
if we send Yennefer to their biggest trade partner.
The only thing Cintra hates more than mages is... elves.
Watch a Cintran do that math.
Let's not model our wisdom on prejudice and paranoia.
Prejudiced or not, you can't deny
Cintra has operated outside our influence far too long.
[Stregobor] Unchecked kings and queens lead to rebellions. Massacres.
It's the reason this chapter was formed.
Still afraid of Falka, are you?
And you, you spare your niece her duties?
Not enough fragrance in Toussaint to take the stench off that nepotism.
Let the Chapter vote, then. I'll even recuse myself.
All in favor of Yennefer to Nilfgaard instead of Fringilla?
I demand an audience with the Chapter.
New items came to light which led me to believe
that you would be a better fit for Nilfgaard.
There's no power in puppeting fools,
especially one who'd sooner fondle his sorceress than listen to her!
I don't think new items came to light.
I think the Chapter overruled you.
The all-powerful sorceress Tissaia de Vriess
knocked down from her glass pedestal.
Efforts in Cintra prevent the Brotherhood
from placing a mage with elven blood in Aedirn's court.
[Triss] You were told to leave Temeria.
Are you going to kill her?
I don't want the miners' coin.
What is this girl to you?
I saw how Foltest and his boy  spoke to you.
Why help those who won't listen?
I'm sure someone as legendary as you
has already figured out several ways to get past Segelin's guards.
Temeria reeks of secrets. I could sense them.
Just like I could these bodies before we entered.
I imagine you sense them, too.
Foltest and Adda. What happened to them?
Not answering questions is a pillar of your brooding charm.
Pretty sure Foltest is the father.
Do you think he cursed her?
From Queen Sancia,  Foltest and Adda's mother.
A Queen Mother cursing her own children for their affair.
Sancia wanted Adda to get rid of the child.
And now she's taken that curse with her to the grave.
You've served the family for decades.
Was Sancia involved in  dark sorcery of any kind?
What was your relationship to Adda?
Well, I like to think that she saw me as a confidant.
We used to talk at great length about her troubles.
What if the relationship was not...
You think he raped Adda, then cursed the child to cover it up?
Well, kings have done more for less.
Your scent was on her sheets.
What would I be doing in a dead girl's bed?
I smelled what you were doing.
He seduced Adda. Abused his position.
He was always nagging her  for attention.
You cursed the woman you loved?
Countless are dead because of your jealousy.
Countless are dead because of Foltest!
He spoiled Adda with his seed.
He refuses to kill this striga.
He lies to his people. And yet you wag your finger in my face.
If you wanted him to suffer, you could have just exposed the affair.
Her memory will not be sullied, not while I'm alive to protect it.
Tell us how to lift the curse.
Foltest will watch as Temeria turns against him.
Just as he turned Adda against me.
I, Sabrina Glevissig, offer myself to the Brotherhood
to make good on the promise  of the Spheres.
To not place power before virtue.
[Sabrina] ...for as long  as my flesh endures.
Welcome to the Brotherhood of Sorcerers. You may perform your enchantment.
I'll have my father sign this deed declaring me his natural-born daughter
Do you really think this slip of paper will fool the Chapter? Yenna--
Get your hands away from me!
It was, uh, an idiotic manipulation. Forgive me.
Can your apology save me from Nilfgaard?
Do they make me more than my blood?
Say you concocted this slander  to gain the favor of your precious rector.
It's too late. You missed initiation.
The enchantments are done. Think clearly.
You're so smart, aren't you? You know everything.
I'm sorry. I had no way of knowing how the information would be used.
Do not turn this on me.
We're pretending your precious rectoress  never ordered you to spy on me?
The Brotherhood--they've offered me a seat on the Research Chapter. Me.
Okay? Neither of us have to go to court.
We can travel the continent together.
We can be together. We can forge a whole new destiny.
A life holding dustpans while you brush off forgotten bones?
Would it frighten you to know you're  not privy to every one of my thoughts?
I was going to Temeria for you.
You really think I wish to waste my days  gossiping at court?
A true man would state his desires.
Well, how would I recognize them? Huh?
You get off on disguising yours  as my own. Oh.
That's exactly why you're here, exactly what she taught you.
I will not be schooled by a man
who pimps the world  as some romantic adventure.
You enter, you survive, you die.
You know, victimhood is not your color.
You're just angry because  you lost your chance to be beautiful!
Seen and adored with everyone watching.
No amount of power or beauty  will ever make you feel worthy of either.
Show Madame de Vriess some respect.
An Aedirnian would surely have had better footing.
[Yennefer] You claim to be  quite the artist. Prove it.
The Chapter would have my head.
Do they already have your cock?
I'll need time to prepare the herbs.
Don't be foolish. You can't be awake during the procedure.
Strange, considering what Miss Merigold  told me about you.
If I can lift the curse.
You're giving me this because you do not expect to see morning.
This isn't my first time trying to save a princess
who others see as a monster.
I did try to resist, at first, with Adda. We both did.
For all it brightens, love casts long shadows.
and never have to fall in love.
What are we doing here? What's happening?
How can I lift the curse?
Foltest must pay for what he did.
Carry me out. I order you.
Tell me how to lift the curse.
Sh-She was hiding from the Brotherhood.
Sh-She told me  to wait until a full moon,
to wait and then to kill it.
And then I recited some silly chant.
And then I bathed in the lamb's blood until sunrise.
Until the rooster crowed three times. And that is all.
I swear. I swear. Now please let us leave.
Wh-- what is it? The-- I-- I've done what you've asked.
Nothing, unless you can  keep a striga out of her crypt
until a fucking rooster crows three times.
You're gonna have to fight her till dawn.
Leave my eyes. These as well.
There is a cost to all creation.
A sacrifice that is always made.
You'd leave a man  bound to die in such indignity?
Please allow me to remove  this misguided girl.
Now, what sort of a king refuses a dance with one of his subjects?
Are you aware that I'm in the market for just such a mage?
The girl in the woods will be with you always.
People call you a monster too.
Your scars. You heal quite nicely.
Your will to live is strong.
I've arranged for her to stay a while  with  the Sisters of Melitele.
You should know Foltest issued a statement.
The honorable Lord Ostrit  gave his life to slay the vukodlak.
Miners are gathering ore for a statue.
Anyone else would've killed the princess.
I need to get back to my horse.
Hers was the only name you uttered  over and over in your sleep.
So that's all life is to you?
It's all it needs to be.
You say this is all life is to you,
but there is a vortex of fate around all of us, Geralt,
growing with each and every one of our choices...
I feel something out there waits for you.
